folder: Bay Street & Broad Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bay Street, west side, between Broad Street and Vanderbilt Ave., showing the United States Marine Hospital. This is the earliest of the buildings which now constitute the hospital. It appears in maps of 1874.
About 1905.
By Eugene G. Putnam.
From Staten Island Museum Collection.
Through P. L. Sperr.

folder: Broad Street & Bay Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
23 to 35 Broad Street, north side, between Bay and Wright Streets. The view is westward from the head of Brownell Street.
February 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Bay Street & Broad Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bay Street, west side, between Broad Street and Vanderbilt Avenue, showing the United States Marine Hospital, seen across the tracks of the Staten Island Railroad from the Upper New York Bay shore. The new
hospital units were erected in 1934.
Views 1, 2: July 22, 1935
View 3: May 25, 1935
P. L. Sperr
